website_summaries.verdict: A great-sounding alternative to standard snare drums. The piccolo snare has a higher register, and this model is of an exceptional quality from a trusted brand.
pros: A 13-inch by 3-inch piccolo snare that has a crisp attack and great action
Steel shell construction coated in a black lacquer for a sleek, stylish finish
Snare switch is smooth and positioned well
cons: May be too pricey for beginners

customer_reviews.title: Love this little guy!
customer_reviews.text: I've had lots of snare drums but this is my first piccolo and I love it! It has a marvelous crack with the snares on but I love it even more with them disengaged. Great sounding drum! The snare throw off is well made and moves easily. The size is fantastic...easy to transport and light to carry. The finish looks good, hoops are quality. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: A. Hill

customer_reviews.title: Crisp!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for several years (like 8) now and it is my favorite drum. I think I bought some REMO drum heads for it but nonetheless, this is a great drum for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Auston Duke Hafen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent and affordable Piccolo Snare
customer_reviews.text: This drum is excellent. It has a great attack to it and a lot of "pop." It's versatile and can be used in any style of music. However, it's best applied to ska, reggae, Latin, and jazz. If you use a lot of rim shots you will love this drum! Also, the price cannot be beat for the value of the instrument. Suggestion: Use a Remo Ambassador with this drum. WARNING: Don't tune too tightly!! It's tempting since it's such a highly pitched drum, but tuning it too high is bad for the drum (and the head).
customer_reviews.author: Duke

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Another nice product from DW. The sound is very good...........
customer_reviews.author: Knife enthusiast

customer_reviews.title: Oh my God!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This snare is awesome!!!!!!! I f*#$*ing love it this was way better then I thought it was going to be. I just love the pop sound and the versatility its like I can get so many different tones Its the best sounding snare I've ever heard. This snare is a masterpiece of innovation.
customer_reviews.author: macon

customer_reviews.title: This is the best deal out there for a quality snare drum in ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the best deal out there for a quality snare drum in my opinion. This drum has a serious pop and cut. It sounds killer when miked and records well too! Well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: rob

customer_reviews.title: Pearl Piccolo snare drum
customer_reviews.text: Got this snare earlier than the time they said , its sounds really good the drummer loves it. It seems pretty sturdy and professional as it is completely steel. Bought it for my church. LOVE IT!!! A recommended buy.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love this drum...my drum of choice no matter what kit I am on...nice cracking sound!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!.
customer_reviews.text: The snare works perfectly. Conforms to all styles of drums and also is small, lightweight and adjustable tuning. 100 percent recommended this product
customer_reviews.author: ROBERTO

customer_reviews.title: Quality snare, good price.
customer_reviews.text: The snare came in quick, it has a nice sound to it and really adds to the overall sound of my kit. For the price it's worth it....there are better piccolo snares of course but I have no complains with what I recieved. Plus it comes with Remo heads that are pretty amazing.
customer_reviews.author: tre8or

customer_reviews.title: great!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted one of these ever since i was 14 (22 now, yeah...) anyways, its awesome!! right out the box how i wanted the top drum head, coated ambassador (it comes this way) i i went straight to placing it from the box to the snare stand, sounds great out of the box, didn't even bother tuning it, its great for the price. im so damn happy.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful drum
customer_reviews.text: it is my joy to have and play this drum along with my other drum. Well made. Also , a good size.
customer_reviews.author: English Major

customer_reviews.title: piccolo snare drum
customer_reviews.text: this is by far the best snare drum I have ever played. I have several drums bought over 4 decades and the staccato of this snare is extremely impressive. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Steven P. Grate

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Great snare sound, right out of the box! Remo heads. Great price and fast service!
customer_reviews.author: Shadowman

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: good, inexpensive snare for practice or performance. Very happy with the sound.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sharp Attacks
customer_reviews.text: This Piccolo Snare is the best. If you tune this snare right, it is amazing, (for me). If you like a nice "POP" to you snare, this is the one you want. Oh by the way, without a piece of moon jell, the snare will ring. But with it, "POP POP POP" is all you'll hear.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin D. Haley Sr.

customer_reviews.title: Besg deal ever
customer_reviews.text: Very nice snare like new. Love the sound. At a great price too. Over satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It was everything expected!
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to tune and has a distict pop to it. It is a great snare drum. The price was right.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Bussard

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!!
customer_reviews.text: Is an amazing snare drum, a great buy for a very low price. Thanks Pearl, thanks GearTree!!!
customer_reviews.author: F. Rodolfo Parisi

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: These are alright for starting off, but I'm going to up grade.
customer_reviews.author: L. Richards

customer_reviews.title: Broken piece
customer_reviews.text: The down patch was broken. I need that you change me this piece. It is the third request and I don't have any responsé frontera you.
customer_reviews.author: TOMAS IREGUI GUERRERO

customer_reviews.title: My favorite snare!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this snare for about eight years. I love it! It has a beautiful crack. Wonderful for more up beat dance type music. I was a ska kid in my high school days, the reason i originally made the purchase. But it sounds great in most musical styles. Every time i play it i get excited and can't help put play more up beat. I've got a lot of good response over the years with people complimenting me on the sound of this snare. If you are looking for a snare that will cut through the noise of a band and stand out this one is it. It will define your sound.
customer_reviews.author: TheOneWhoAbides

customer_reviews.title: One of the best sounding piccolo snares out there!!
customer_reviews.text: This is an all around quality piccolo snare drum. I play a few different styles of music, and I definitely prefer the pop that this snare gives off. Nicely crafted and manufactured and great snare all around! If you prefer the 'tight' piccolo sound over the deep overtones of your traditional snare, make no mistake, this is one of the best (not to mention reasonably priced)!
customer_reviews.author: Rob V.

customer_reviews.title: Crisp, Clean, and Affordable!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE LOVE LOVE this snare. I've been playing on it for about four years and it never fails to give me that crisp pop I'm really looking for in a quality snare. I've been drumming for 13 years with numerous live acts and I wouldn't think of changing out my snare for another one! This is a great piece of equipment and can usually be found on sale for around $100 if you look hard enough, that's how much I got mine at. Fantastic buy! Gotta love Pearl!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Jo

customer_reviews.title: Great drum.
customer_reviews.text: Great drum at a good price. I primarily used an Evans G2 batter and the snare side or came with and it sounded great. Nice pop without the metally overtones.
customer_reviews.author: Marquaveous

customer_reviews.title: Great value and performance
customer_reviews.text: I have this bad boy and it rocks, really it CRACKS like crazy. Great for reggae/ska, hip hop, punk rock, electro, funk, or anything where rim shots are your bread and butter. Actually has some nice shell sound considering it's a piccolo. Stays in tune really well and you can crank the bejeezus out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Aadip Desai

product_meta.title: Pearl S1330B 13 x 3 Inches Black Steel Piccolo Snare Drum
product_meta.description: Piccolo and Effects Snare Drums have become some of the most widely used and best selling Snare Drums in popular music today. Their crisp brilliant attack and tight sound with excellent projection have led many players to use them as both a secondary and primary snare. Pearl's 13'x3' Piccolo Snare Drums are available with your choice of Brass, Maple or Steel shell. Each offers a slightly different tone and voicing, allowing you to fine tune the pitch to best suit your personal needs. The item number listed on this page is for an individual component drum, not a complete kit. The photograph on the left may be an example of a complete kit or of a similar component drum and is intended to be a representation of the piece you are ordering. Please pay close attention to the description when ordering each component piece.
feature_bullets: Compact and affordable with plenty of snap

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
